feed.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Primer
feed.subtitle: This week, the Dose.ca guinea pigs tested face primers. Find out which ones made our skin picture-perfect and which ones left us looking like we spent a sweaty day at the gym.

content.div:
This week, the Dose.ca guinea pigs tested face primers. Find out which ones made our skin picture-perfect and which ones left us looking like we spent a sweaty day at the gym.



Smashbox Photo Finish (Available at Shoppers Drug Mart; suggested retail price: $39)

"I only needed a small amount of this primer to cover my face completely. The texture glides over your skin easily, making it smooth and covering noticeable pores. It definitely made my foundation spread further and created a matte finish. Although it is on the pricy side, it will save you money on foundation in the long run. Rating: 4.5/5" - Jennifer Simone

"Smashbox was a clear smash in my books. The bottle may be small, but this primer packs a powerful punch. I found that the coverage was great and when it came to application, I needed very little to get the results that I wanted -- making it a little bit easier to swallow spending $32 on such a small bottle. This is definitely getting prime placement in my beauty drawer. Rating: 4.5/5" -Miranda Furtado

"I loved the Smashbox primer. It had a silky texture and I only needed to use a small amount to cover my entire face. My pores looked almost nonexistent and my face remained shine-free, even seven hours after applying my makeup. Even though it was on the pricey side, I definitely think it’s worth the money, especially because a small bottle would last a really long time. Rating: 5/5" - Stephanie Woods

“Worn under foundation, Smashbox appeared to work just as well as the others, but if I were only to wear a primer with no other makeup, it would have to be Smashbox; after putting it on, my pores looked much smaller and my skin felt fantastic. The only problem was the price – no matter how good the product, I can’t justify spending $32 on a small bottle of anything. Rating: 4/5” – Kat Angus

“Smashbox is known for its primer and it’s easy to see why. The gel-like product left my skin feeling velvety smooth and made my foundation stay put for the entire day. Most impressively, it filled out the fine lines and wrinkles under my eyes, making it something I’d wear even on the days I skip foundation. Rating: 5/5” –Jen McDonnell


Hard Candy Sheer Envy (Available at Wal-Mart; suggested retail price: $8)

"I was kind of worried when I first saw the Hard Candy primer because it looked really shimmery, but when I put in on, it didn’t leave any shimmer on my face. It was really lightweight and easy to apply, but I found it a little bit greasy. It felt like my makeup was slipping off of my face. The first time I tried it I thought it was because I put too much on, but I tried it a few more times using smaller amounts and I ended up with the same results. It made my pores appear slightly smaller, and my face was more radiant and less shiny than when I wear foundation only, but I didn’t find that my foundation lasted any longer than usual. Rating: 3/5" - Stephanie Woods

"In the past I've found the affordable Hard Candy line has been a great option when I want to save money on cosmetics. Unfortunately, this primer couldn’t compete with the others I tested. It was a little too greasy and left my skin with a really weird texture. While my pores did appear smaller, I found that overall the texture and the added greasy feeling just wasn't for me. Rating: 2.5/5" -Miranda Furtado

“At only $8, I was predisposed to like Hard Candy the best, but I was glad when the primer didn’t disappoint: it did a great job of keeping my foundation from smudging or wearing off during the day. It didn’t reduce the look of my pores the same way the Smashbox primer did, but I’m not so obsessed with my pores that I’m going to turn my nose up at an $8 primer over the issue. It keeps my makeup on and it’s inexpensive, so I’m sold. Rating: 4.5/5” – Kat Angus


Sephora Ultra Smoothing Primer (Available at Sephora; suggested retail price: $16.00)

"After trying the Smashbox primer, this product left me underwhelmed. I needed to use more of the product to cover my face and although it went on smoothly, it felt heavier. It did make my foundation spread further and had no scent, however. I wouldn’t recommend this product for someone with combination or oily skin as it will make your face shiny as the day goes on. Since this bottle contains half the amount of Smashbox, it works out to be the same price, so you’re not saving any money by opting for this product. Rating: 2.5/5" - Jennifer Simone

“As far as I’m concerned, there was no difference between the Sephora primer and the Hard Candy primer – except that the Sephora primer costs twice as much. I’ll pass. Rating: 3/5” – Kat Angus


Nars Pro-Prime (Available at department stores; suggested retail price: $32)

“The Nars primer was immediately a different experience from the other primers: there was a much stronger smell and it absorbed into my skin like a lotion. Other than that, it served its purpose well; I probably wouldn’t use the Nars on its own but it did a beautiful job as making my foundation stay put. At the end of the day, though, I’d rather use a primer that didn’t make my nose scrunch up, even if it’s only a little. Plus, I’ve already made it clear that $32 is far too steep for me. Rating: 3/5” – Kat Angus

“While all the other primer I tested were gels, Nars looks like a white lotion. It goes on clear though, but the texture is much different. While the others felt like they were gliding over my skin, this one absorbed into my skin right away, which meant that I didn’t have to wait for it to set before applying my foundation. It made my foundation last longer than usual, but it didn’t appear to fill in my fine lines or reduce my pore size all that much. If I’m shelling out $32 for primer, I’m sticking to the equally priced but higher performing Smashbox. Rating: 3/5” –Jen McDonnell
